730340f-a.title: General view - Cedar Street - Northeast.
730340f-a.text:
No. 1 Cedar Street;. Pearl Street, west side, from Cedar Street to Maicen Lane, (general view northeastward). A series of three Views towards the East River and its Brooklyn, and Manhattan Bridges. The buildings in the foreground are on the opposite side of Pearl Street (shown in View 2) and consist ainly of 4 and f story business structures. At the top left is the excavation for the new 35 story building ~So. 1 Platt Street. Across Pearl Street appears the lower portion of the New York Steam Co. plant (prominent in View o. 3).
July 7, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

723940f-a.text:
60 Wall Street Tower, on the west side,of Pearl Street, between Pine and Cedar Streets, as viewed from 120 Wall Street (N.W. corner of South Street). Buildings also shown are: the FarmerCs Loan &: Trust Company (120 Williams Street), the Bank of Manhattan Company (4O Wall Street), the Equitable Building (12O Broadway), and the Woolworth Tower (229-237 Broadway)
About 1932.
